  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operation a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained two glass bottles and three plastic bottles. One of the glass bottles broke spilling it's contents. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package.

item.title: Report E-2025040456
item.description:
Report E-2025040456

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-16
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 16, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1263 was punctured and released approximately twenty-five (25) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSEs) to remediate the site. Crews deployed absorbents to the impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All spend absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums. The damaged drum was placed into one (1) 85-gallon drum.

item.description:
Report X-2025041286

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-10
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a steel drum was discovered with signs of a release. The drum was damaged on the bottom chime causing the release. It was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2025040839
item.description:
Report X-2025040839

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-12T03:42:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-08
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH location. Inside of the fiberboard box was four metal cans with positive closure tabs. The lid on one can opened and spilled its contents inside of the box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
